channel.title: World 1237 - Hackers
channel.description:
Ok, a Normal RSCD v25 server uses world 30...
But some hackers came in used world 1237 and Got max lvled Fked my Economy and ect...
How can i Remove this world.. ;\ Or anything i can do against it?

item.title: World 1237 - Hackers
item.dc:creator: @EndlessLife EndlessLife
item.description:
@EndlessLife wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:27, topic:240083”]Wow, you’re still all wrong…

just change ls.conf to use localhost, it doesn’t need to bind to an internet address…

Make the gameserver talk to it locally too. Saves bandwidth as well…

failing that just block the ports in your firewall…

btw xEnt, there is a check somewhere for multiple worlds with the same ID[/quote][quote=“KO9, post:27, topic:240083”]Wow, you’re still all wrong…

just change ls.conf to use localhost, it doesn’t need to bind to an internet address…

Make the gameserver talk to it locally too. Saves bandwidth as well…

failing that just block the ports in your firewall…

btw xEnt, there is a check somewhere for multiple worlds with the same ID[/quote]

xEnt u made this Guy doing this, so i probbaly think u can fix this - Btw Ban Rs2pker Anoying Spam in RSC … -

Ok… All i Request…

Is a Small Guide, that will help me to Make this guy… ‘‘Usd’’ ‘‘So Alone’’ ‘‘Bannana’’ To not make itself level 123, unban and adding itself items.
My Mysql and php is full secured as far as i know…

So Please a Small Guide, with helpfull text…
Not Spams that others are wrong ;\ i need 1 good guide

item.title: World 1237 - Hackers
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Wow, you’re still all wrong…

just change ls.conf to use localhost, it doesn’t need to bind to an internet address…

Make the gameserver talk to it locally too. Saves bandwidth as well…

failing that just block the ports in your firewall…

btw xEnt, there is a check somewhere for multiple worlds with the same ID

Read full topic

item.title: World 1237 - Hackers
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Your all wrong.

Since RSCD can log in 2 worlds with the same number (at least i can’t see a check) your going to have to add things your self.

public java.util.ArrayList reggedServers = new java.util.ArrayList();

int [] allowedServerWorlds = {5, 7}; // World 5 and 7 are only allowed to be registered. Change this if you like.

		boolean allow = false;
		for(int i=0; i < allowedServerWorlds.length; i++)
			if(allowedServerWorlds[i] == id)
				allow = true;

   if(world == null && !reggedServers.contains(id) && allow) {
      world = new World(id, session);
      server.registerWorld(world);
      System.out.println("Registering world: " + id);
      reggedServers.add(id);
    }

Read full topic

    if(world == null) {
      world = new World(id, session);
      server.registerWorld(world);
      System.out.println("Registering world: " + id);
    }

thats the default

should be if world!=id try that

good try, but your not quite on the dot.
[/quote]Yet he managed to fix it and post the code in a different topic. Seems quite on the dot to me.[/quote]
